definitions.definition: A method of detecting distant objects and determining their position , velocity , or other characteristics by analysis of sent radio waves (usually microwaves ) reflected from their surfaces .
examples: They were able to find the enemy fleet using radar .

definitions.definition: A type of system using such a method, differentiated by platform , configuration , frequency , power , and other technical attributes .
examples: The Ministry of Defence funded the development of an entirely new radar and improved avionics.

definitions.definition: An installation or instance of such a system or of the transmitting and receiving apparatus .
examples: Each of these aircraft has been upgraded with a new radar and a more powerful engine.

definitions.definition: A superior ability to detect something.
examples: His sensitive radar for hidden alliances keeps him out of trouble.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) A method of detecting distant objects and determining their position , velocity , or other characteristics by analysis of sent radio waves (usually microwaves ) reflected from their surfaces .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A type of system using such a method, differentiated by platform , configuration , frequency , power , and other technical attributes .
( countable ) An installation or instance of such a system or of the transmitting and receiving apparatus .
( countable , figuratively ) A superior ability to detect something.
